meanings.definition: To commit or give trust or confidence to
meanings.sent1: I am intrusting my secret to you.
meanings.sent2: She is intrusting her savings to the bank.
meanings.sent3: By intrusting him with the task, we hope for success.
meanings.sent4: Intrusting our dreams to the wind, we set off on a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The act of intrusting requires a leap of faith.

meanings.definition: To place in care or charge of
meanings.sent1: The teacher is intrusting the class pet to a student for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: He intrusted his keys to his neighbor while he was on vacation.
meanings.sent3: Intrusting the keys to the cat would be a mistake!
meanings.sent4: She intrusted her heart to him, hoping he would cherish it.
meanings.sent5: Intrusting the responsibility to her was a wise choice.

meanings.sent1: The traveler intrusted her valuables to the hotel safe.
meanings.sent2: He intrusted the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent3: Intrusting the cookies to the cookie monster would be risky!
meanings.sent4: She intrusted her memories to a journal, preserving them for the future.
meanings.sent5: Intrusting the secret to the diary ensured it would be kept safe.
